title: What happens if I only fail 8th grade math? Will I be held back? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say it depends on your school and location. It’s more likely that you’ll be sent to Summer school and if you pass Math then you’ll move on, it not then you’ll be held back. The more important factor though is not to get down on yourself. Don’t feel because you failed 8th grade math your life is going to collapse. If you’re interested in Math then spend your spare time practicing. Watch videos do challenge problems and so on. If you’re not interested in Math then do your best to pass, not everyone is good at everything. Me personally I could barely pass Biology courses even after insane amounts of studying. None of this diminishes your value, find what you’re good at and stick with it. In your case I’m assuming you’re somewhat interested in Math, so I would say take a look at Khan Academy or YouTube. There are tons of free resources to help you out. Ultimately, try to understand the WHY behind the math rather than the HOW. Don’t memorize steps, but logically think through problems and WHY you would figure them out in a particular way.

What happens if I only fail 8th grade math? Will I be held back? Ask your teacher or counselor what your school’s policy is. Speak electronically if you cannot speak in person. Social media cannot provide a credible a swer. The math you are taking MAY affect the answer. Or not.
